content:
Hi!

I really like the dark mode syntax highlighting theme. Is it a custom one made by Zulip, does it have a name? I'd like to use it for my code editor if possible :)
@Giacomo it's our own work; you can find it in static/styles/dark_theme.css (search for .codehilite).
Thanks Tim! If I make a theme based off of it for Sublime text, would you prefer I keep it private, or make it open-source via a GitHub repo?

Screenshot-2023-01-07-at-1.16.37-am.png

Not a perfect copy, but close enough for now, really like it. Currently only have the file locally :)

@Giacomo From searching the original hex colors on Google, I found that they seem to be present in a Vim theme called Zenburn. Iâ€™m not sure what the lineage is. But various ports of Zenburn to Sublime Text seem to exist.
Yes, looking at Zenburn, it seems to be Zenburn with the background set to: #171E26 (and maybe some other small adjustments)
